response.answer_text: Wow, microwaves applications are alot: 1-Communication and radar system (telephone networks, broadcast, television, space communication). 2-Radio Astronomy and remote sensing application. 3-Basic and application research (nuclear and atomic system display a various resonance when subjected to EM field and many of them in MW). 4-Industrial and domestic applications. 5-Biochemical applications (Cancer therapy). 6-A potential application in the field of energy.

Q: What uses microwave waves? Microwaves are the electromagnetic waves from 1 meter in length to 1 millimeter, with frequency ranging from 300 megahertz to 300 gigahertz. The lower range include many frequencies used for various types of radio communications. Other uses are Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. Radar uses microwaves. They are even to to heat food with at a frequency of 2.45 Ghz. See: Microwave - Wikipedia
